newsitem.title: CHINA: FORECAST-China 97 economic growth seen at 10.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-China 97 economic growth seen at 10.5 pct.

text.p: China's economy is expected to grow 10.5 percent in 1997, with inflation kept under six percent, the China Daily on Thursday quoted an official thinktank as saying.
Economists and experts at a seminar in Beijing had generally agreed with the forecasts by the Institute of Economy, a research body under the State Planning Commission, the newspaper said.

Abundant commodity stockpiles and high foreign exchange reserves would help to keep inflation down while reform of China's lumbering state-owned enterprises was expected to bolster economic growth, it said.
The People's Bank of China, the central bank, has predicted that Beijing's tough tight-credit policy will cool 1996 economic growth to under 10 percent.
Official forecasts say inflation in 1996 will be about 6.5 percent, down from last year's 14.8 percent and 1994's communist-era high of 21.7 percent.
